well, it becomes really overpowered when playing on a small table

posts.post_content: I love playing this card. The dynamic it brings to a game can be fun. I think I had one just before it got banned but I played it after the banning in casual games (with my opponents permission of course) and it was always quite fun. I would love for dexterity cards to be brought back into the game but maybe with different wording and a more structured process described in the rules text so that those arguments can be settled just by reading the card.

Rating:

posts.post_content: Our play group got *really* good at flipping this bad boy and causing serious destruction. We had to implement a house rule: as long as no Chaos Orbs were in play, a player may space their permanents out as far apart as they wished, but once one was cast, all permanents had to stay right were they were; any permanents cast after the orb was in play could be placed wherever the controller wished though (as long as it was still on the table and didn't mix into the games being played on either side!)
posts.html:
